title: Development of Learning Transfer Strategies for Simulation-Based Mathematics Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with basic mathematics pedagogy and simulation tool utilization
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers experience designing and executing math lessons in VR simulations mimicking real classrooms, accessing simulations via personal devices in BYOD environments, and conducting team projects followed by final product evaluations

learning_goals: Learners achieve 80% or higher performance in designing math lessons within VR simulation environments reflecting real classroom situations.
Learners apply at least 70% of strategies acquired from simulation training to actual math classroom instruction.
Learners develop three or more transfer strategies connecting simulation-based training experiences to real educational contexts through peer assessment.

resources: VR Simulation Software for Mathematics Education

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
